document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

subSubSection.paragraph:
45.
Theognete galvezi Anderson
, new species
( Figures 133 , 169 , 204 )

Diagnosis. Size. Length, male, 3.37mm ; female, 3.20–3.46mm . Width, male, 1.96mm ; female, 1.79–2.13mm . As for
T. confusa
but pronotum with impunctate areas in middle and laterally in posterior half. Aedeagus as in Fig. 169 . This species is questionably distinct from
T. confusa
.
Natural history . Collected from berlese extraction of various types of forest leaf litter at 1530–2160m .
Derivation of specific name . Named after Rafael Solis Galvez of Jaltenango, a very helpful guard and park ranger at the El Triunfo Biosphere Reserve, Chiapas , México , during my trip there in 2001.

Material examined .
75♂ , 68♀♀ ( BMNH , CMNC , CWOB , ECOS , UNAM , UVGC )
.
Holotype ♂ ( UNAM )
:
MÉXICO : Chiapas . Municipio Angel Albino Corzo , Reserva El Triunfo , Polígono 1, 2050m, 15°39.428'N . 92°48.537'W ,
16–21.XI.2001
, R.S. Anderson , oak forest litter, 2001-203A
/
